documents.document: And then, if Republicans win big in LITERALLY ANY PRESIDENTIAL YEAR, they can increase it to 21 or 55 or Eleventy Gillion and One. This is a stupid idea that, once started, will escalate to absurdity in record time. https://t.co/2h0X4WwcOi

@wxgeek @senatorshoshana Assuming a highly seasonal wardrobe (Willie Brown, another political clotheshorse recommends three navy blazers, one for each season); he could easily spend $600,000 on suits alone. That leaves $200,000 for other rare accessories like high end watches and handmade shoes.

@wxgeek @senatorshoshana It's not hard to spend $800,000 on clothes if someone wants expensive fabrics. A bespoke suit with high-twist (Super 180s and above) wool will be $10-20k from a high-end tailor. Vicuña and other Veblen good fabrics can run as high as $50,000.

@wxgeek @senatorshoshana Trump's tie length is awful and while he may intend a longer tie to cover his girth, it only draws attention by moving the eye lower on his body. To look slimmer, he should consider suits with a vest or a rolled three button jacket with minimal darting a la J. Press.

Most importantly, state affairs associate Brian Jencunas is available for the definitive opinion on politicians' clothing choices. Need someone to trash Trump's tie length, call me. Need someone to explain how Paul Manafort spent $800,000 on clothes, I'm your man. https://t.co/eGlGBSQNcx
